intro: Oriastrum cochlearifolium, commonly known as the desert globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its globular shape, with dense clusters of yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. Its leaves are palmately lobed, giving it a distinctive appearance, and it thrives in arid and semi-arid environments. Oriastrum cochlearifolium is adapted to withstand drought conditions, making it a hardy species in desert ecosystems.
